name: Ibn Battuta Online Trivia | People | 10 Questions

questions.text: How old was Ibn Battuta when he began his travels?
questions.explanation:
21.

	I guess he needed a lot of time, since he travelled so much.

questions.text: Of what religion was Ibn Battuta?
Which continent did Battuta NOT visit?
questions.explanation:
North America.

	He visited Muslim Spain in Europe, but that was all.

questions.text: Which country does NOT occupy an area where Battuta visited?
questions.explanation:
Germany.

	Yes, he did not travel into northern Europe.

questions.text: What year did Battuta begin his travels?
questions.explanation:
1325 AD.

	And they lasted about thirty years.

questions.text: About how long did Battuta's travels last?
questions.explanation:
30 years.

	He went a long way too.

questions.text: About how many miles did Battuta travel?
questions.explanation:
More than 75,000 miles.

	He must have had sore feet... (Unless he rode on camels - then the camels must have had sore feet!)

Abu Abdullah Muhammad Ibn Battuta.

	No wonder he went by Ibn.

questions.text: What country was Battuta born in?
questions.explanation:
Morocco.

	He did travel to all those other countries.

questions.text: How many times did Battuta make the Hajj to Mecca?
questions.explanation:
7.

	Making the Hajj is one of the Five Pillars of Islam... The others are the statement of faith, the duty to pray, giving alms, and fasting.
